bibl.title: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, November 22, 1907

div1.p: Ida Kissinger discusses John Kissinger's pension and thanks Kelly.

div1.head: Letter from John R. and Ida E. Kissinger to Howard A. Kelly, November 22, 1907
div1.opener:
Pension papers
returned
C.S.
South Board Ind, 11/22/07
Dear Dr Kelly
div1.p:
yours of
19Inst at hand and were quite
Surprised that you did not know
Mr. Kissinger gets a Pension of $12
a month through a Special Act last
congress we thought we had Surely
mentioned it in our letters to you-
as to Papers sent in there has been
several of them sent to Pension
Board but we have no coppies of
them but he has the bills of Congr-
ess - and senate and the committee
on Pension reports and will send
them to you and I will give you
no of Pension Certificate 1, 131, 327
Ac
Ki
the Special Act Roll, No 1648
I do not know wheather this is
what you wanted or not but
we havent never done much as
to getting his Pension as others
have done for him I think he
would not have tried but for
friends to urge him on he
always felt if he did the
People would think he wanted
Recompence for what he has
done we can send Statements
from Dr Dean and Other Dr
here in this City if we
know what you want
Mr Kissinger is quite weak
at times is real miserable
I feel greatly relieved from
some of my hard work and
have only Dr Kelly and his good
Kind friends to thank for it
we are enjoying a lovely-
winter here without snow and
Very little Sickness as yet
I will bring this to a close
thanking you many times for
your kindness to us and
if there is anything else
you wish to know write and
you will here from us Promptly
div1.closer:
Kindest Regards from- Mr Kissinger Mrs John R Kissinger
606 E Keasey St
South Bend Ind.
P.S after you are through with the Paper
if Its convenient Pleas' return them
Mr. Kissinger wants to keep them
